alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 7:50PM CST until February 11 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Arkansas... Spring River At Hardy affecting Sharp and Fulton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River At Hardy. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water is breaking out of the banks and flooding low lying areas along the river. At 12.0 feet, Some flooding in City Park and in River Bend Campground. Water may be near homes along the riverbank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet by tomorrow morning (Feb 09). - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Spring River Hardy 10.0 10.0 Wed 7 PM 10.2 6.5 5.2 12.0 6 AM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
